item.title: 温克艾沃斯双胞胎以 1.47 亿美元的交易支持欧盟比特币财政公司
item.description: 比特币财务公司Treasury B.V.周三发表声明称，该公司已通过由亿万富翁卡梅隆-温克莱沃斯（Cameron Winklevoss）和泰勒-温克莱沃斯（Tyler Winklevoss）的风险投资公司牵头的一轮私募融资筹集到1.26亿欧元（约合1.47亿美元）的初始资金。【原文：Bitcoin treasury company Treasury B.V. said it had raised initial funding of €126 million ($147 million) through a private round led by the venture capital firm of billionaires Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, according to a company statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 黑山总统要求中央银行行长与批评者作斗争
item.description: 关于独立中央银行的优点，黑山总统无需多言。这位欧洲复兴开发银行的前经济学家亲自挑选了行长伊雷娜-拉多维奇，并敦促她 "顶住压力，奋力拼搏"。【原文：Montenegro’s president needs no persuading about the virtues of an independent central bank. The former economist at the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development personally picked Governor Irena Radovic and is urging her “to withstand the pressure, to fight.”】

item.title: 人类学股份推动卡塔尔 5,240 亿美元财富基金深入人工智能领域
item.description: 当 Anthropic 开始寻求更多资金来支持其建立人工智能模型时，这家初创公司向熟悉的风险投资人网络求助。这也为它打开了一扇资金来源的大门：中东主权财富。【原文：When Anthropic went looking for more money to support its pursuit of building artificial intelligence models, the startup turned to a familiar network of venture capitalists. It also opened the door to a source of capital it had previously ignored: Middle Eastern sovereign wealth.】

item.title: 简街在印度市场操纵指控的反击中提出上诉
item.description: 简街集团有限责任公司（Jane Street Group LLC）对印度证券监管机构关于其操纵市场的指控提出质疑，称其无法获得辩护所需的关键文件。【原文：Jane Street Group LLC has challenged an allegation by India’s securities regulator that it manipulated the market, arguing it was denied access to crucial documents needed for its defense.】

item.title: 参议院快速举行听证会，特朗普重塑美联储的努力取得进展
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普重塑美联储的运动在周四取得了进展，参议院加快了对他提名一位亲密顾问担任央行行长的确认听证会。【原文：President Donald Trump’s campaign to reshape the Federal Reserve gains ground on Thursday with an accelerated Senate confirmation hearing on his nomination of a close adviser to be a governor of the central bank.】

item.title: Polar 推出无需订阅费的类似 Whoop 的健身手环
item.description: 芬兰健身硬件品牌 Polar Electro Oy 推出了一款无屏健身手环，其外形酷似 Whoop Inc.【原文：Finnish fitness-hardware brand Polar Electro Oy unveiled a screen-free fitness band that looks like — and directly competes with — a popular model from Whoop Inc., and notably does not carry a subscription fee.】

item.title: 受关税影响，南非商业情绪降至一年来最低点
item.description: 随着企业开始应对上个月开始生效的美国关税新时代，南非的商业景气度降至一年来的最低水平。【原文：South African business sentiment fell to the lowest level in a year, as firms began navigating a new era of US tariffs that kicked in last month.】

item.title: 英国央行布里登称稳定币可提供更快、更便宜的支付方式
item.description: 英格兰银行副行长萨拉-布里登（Sarah Breeden）表示，在央行准备公布稳定币监管计划之际，稳定币可以使跨境资金流动更快、成本更低。【原文：Bank of England Deputy Governor Sarah Breeden said stablecoins could make moving money across borders faster and less costly as the central bank prepares to unveil its plans to regulate them.】

item.title: 美联储加息在即，股市多头警惕全球债券暴跌
item.description: 9 月历来是美国股市走势最差的月份，日历翻到 9 月，这在自 4 月初以来推动股市上涨 29% 的股票多头中激起了一些焦虑情绪。【原文：The flip of the calendar to September, historically the worst month for US equities, has stirred some anxieties among stock bulls who drove a 29% rally since early April.】

item.title: 汉莎航空利用可转换债券市场再融资 6 亿欧元
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司（Deutsche Lufthansa AG）希望通过出售 6 亿欧元（约合 6.97 亿美元）的七年期可转换债券进行债务再融资，从而推动欧洲股票挂钩市场的发展。【原文：Deutsche Lufthansa AG is looking to refinance debt through the sale of €600 million ($697 million) in seven-year convertible bonds, giving a boost to Europe’s equity-linked market.】

item.title: 土耳其反对派在裁决令市场恐慌后呼吁举行抗议活动
item.description: 土耳其主要反对党呼吁周三在伊斯坦布尔举行抗议活动，此前法院对该党的一项意外裁决加剧了人们对该国民主统治的担忧，并在上一交易日导致股市损失 92 亿美元。【原文：Turkey’s main opposition party has called for protests in Istanbul on Wednesday, after a surprise court ruling against the party escalated fears about the country’s democratic rule and wiped out $9.2 billion from the stock market in the previous session.】

item.title: 报告发现，无牌赌场瞄准英国禁赌应用程序用户
item.description: 无照经营的境外赌场越来越多地利用与 GamStop（问题赌徒用来将自己排除在受监管的博彩网站之外的应用程序）相关的搜索词，瞄准英国的弱势群体。【原文：Unlicensed offshore casinos are increasingly targeting vulnerable people in the UK by exploiting search terms linked to GamStop, an app that problem gamblers use to exclude themselves from regulated gaming sites.】

item.title: 尽管市场疲软，土耳其财富基金仍坚持债券销售计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，土耳其财富基金正在按计划于周三出售美元债券，周二因主要反对党的法院裁决而引发市场动荡后，该基金曾考虑推迟出售计划。【原文：Turkey’s wealth fund is moving ahead with a planned sale of dollar bonds on Wednesday, after considering postponing it following market upheaval on Tuesday in response to a court ruling regarding the main opposition party, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 联邦爱马仕称，美股收益稳健，可逢低买入
item.description: Federated Hermes 公司副首席投资官 Steve Chiavarone 认为，由于企业盈利和经济前景依然强劲，美股的回落可能是短暂和浅层的。【原文：The retreat in US stocks is likely to be short and shallow as corporate earnings and the economic outlook remain robust, according to Steve Chiavarone, deputy chief investment officer at Federated Hermes.】

item.title: 全球债券退潮，长端国债收益率逼近 5
item.description: 随着全球政府债券抛售的加深，国债下跌，使美国 30 年期借贷成本自 7 月份以来首次接近 5%。【原文：Treasuries fell, lifting US 30-year borrowing costs to within a whisker of touching 5% for the first time since July, as a global selloff of government bonds deepened.】

item.title: 维也纳警方打击涉嫌逃税和欺诈的拉布布商店
item.description: 奥地利海关人员突袭了维也纳市中心的一家拉布布临时专卖店，怀疑店主逃税并销售伪造的毛绒玩偶。【原文：Austrian customs officers have raided a pop-up Labubu store in central Vienna, suspecting its proprietors of tax evasion and selling falsified versions of the hyped plush dolls.】

item.title: 英国劳力士销量第一，前景看好，关税担忧缓解
item.description: 瑞士钟表集团公司（Watches of Switzerland Group Plc）的股价创下自 4 月份以来的最大涨幅，此前该公司对上半年财政年度的展望缓解了投资者对美国关税影响的担忧。【原文：Watches of Switzerland Group Plc shares rose the most since April after the company’s outlook for the first half of its financial year eased investors’ concerns over the impact of US tariffs.】

item.title: 英国预算问题再次震撼债券市场
item.description: 英国的预算问题再次席卷英国市场，因为投资者越来越担心政府是否有能力在不拖累经济的情况下维持财政正常运转。【原文：Britain’s budget troubles are ripping through UK markets again as investors grow ever more wary of the government’s ability to keep its financial house in order without hobbling the economy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行行长表示，澳大利亚央行员工 "感受到了 "人工智能和技术转变的压力
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行行长米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）表示，澳大利亚储备银行的员工正在 "感受到 "其技术转型议程的 "重量"，并补充说，大数据和人工智能的使用有可能改变政策制定。【原文：Reserve Bank of Australia staff are “feeling the weight” of its technological transformation agenda, Governor Michele Bullock said, adding that the use of big data and artificial intelligence has the potential to transform policy making.】

item.title: 德意志银行的 Sewing 称债券大跌并非 "突发事件
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）首席执行官克里斯蒂安-斯温（Christian Sewing）表示，由于全球各国政府都在努力实施改革和财政纪律，他预计未来几个月债券收益率将继续走高。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG Chief Executive Christian Sewing said he expects bond yields to remain elevated in coming months as governments across the world struggle to implement reforms and fiscal discipline.】

item.title: 德国服务业 8 月份意外萎缩
item.description: 德国服务业上月出现萎缩，弹性低于最初估计。【原文：Germany’s services sector shrank last month, proving less resilient than initially estimated.】

item.title: 欧盟法院支持美国数据协议，避免新一轮隐私保护之争
item.description: 欧盟普通法院支持该集团与美国达成的数据传输协议，驳回了一项法律挑战，该挑战认为美国的监控法律仍未达到欧盟的隐私标准。【原文：The European Union’s General Court backed the bloc’s data transfer agreement with the US, rejecting a legal challenge that argued American surveillance laws still fall short of EU privacy standards.】

item.title: 现金拮据的购物者阻碍了伍尔沃斯推动时尚的步伐
item.description: 伍尔沃斯控股有限公司（Woolworths Holdings Ltd.）最近修复服装部门的努力遇到了障碍：南非和澳大利亚消费者的可支配收入捉襟见肘。【原文：Woolworths Holdings Ltd.’s latest efforts to fix its clothing unit have hit an obstacle: Consumers in South African and Australia struggling with strained disposable incomes.】

item.title: 日本国防和债务预算申请达到创纪录的 8220 亿美元
item.description: 随着偿债成本的增加，日本各部委和机构在下一财年的预算中提出了创纪录的 122.4 万亿日元（8220 亿美元）的支出要求，同时日本还希望增加国防支出。【原文：Japanese ministries and agencies made a record request for ¥122.4 trillion ($822 billion) in spending in the budget for next fiscal year as debt-servicing costs rise while the nation also eyes more outlays for defense.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯发行 55 亿美元债券，创下发行纪录
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯周二出售了 55 亿美元的国际债券，以帮助其填补预算赤字，这使其在王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）的经济多元化项目上继续投入巨资，从而使其今年的债券发行量创下历史新高。【原文：Saudi Arabia sold $5.5 billion of international bonds on Tuesday to help plug its budget deficit, putting it on course for a record year of issuance as it continues to spend heavily on Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s economic-diversification projects.】
